2d797b07-f9f9-49f4-b5d2-ba3c7d675866.description: Researches and compares the scope, nature, and requirements of current and emerging careers in educational design and technology [0.25]
2d797b07-f9f9-49f4-b5d2-ba3c7d675866.name: Careers in Educational Design and Technology

badge_template_activities.title: A list of at least 10 current jobs in the world that are seeking a person with knowledge or skill in educational technology or the skill evident in a person who meets the ISTE technology coach standards. A 3-5 sentence summary of each job, the responsibilities, & the required knowledge and skill for that job. Indication of whether each job is of current or future interest, and what knowledge or skill, if any, the learner would need to develop in order to get and perform well in each
Explanation of the value or benefit of each job. How does such a job enable a person to model love of neighbor or helping and benefiting others?

464ddf35-d4d7-457e-a5cf-6281be0bf8e2.description: Reads and analyzes quantitative research with attention to the strengths and weaknesses of quantitative models  [0.25]
464ddf35-d4d7-457e-a5cf-6281be0bf8e2.name: Quantitative Research Methods Foundation

badge_template_activities.title: Identification of two or more peer-reviewed journal articles that use quantitative research, including the following for each article: a summary of the study that: identifies the research question(s), describes and explains the research method(s), and reports on the findings.

Also included for each article is an evaluation/explanation of how the research did or did not achieve validity, reliability, and generalizability; and a description of how the findings of the article can be used to inform educational practice (while noting the limitations and cautions of applying the findings to a new or different context).

Also included for each article is a proposal of two or more ways to improve the quality of the study, based upon cited best practices in quantitative research; and a proposal for different quantitative research methods that could be used to pursue answers to the same or similar research question(s), including an explanation of the strengths and limitations between the newly proposed research methods and the method(s) used in the study.

2ddf46e1-d08c-49c0-b26b-3aa0936c8631.description: Leverages several current and emerging 21st century learning models and frameworks to create a persuasive presentation that illustrates the critical skills needed to thrive in the 21st and 22nd century work and life contexts  [0.5]
2ddf46e1-d08c-49c0-b26b-3aa0936c8631.name: 21st Century Learning Models and Frameworks

badge_template_activities.title: An artifact that shows by explanation and example the recognition of the concepts of: 21st century themes; learning and innovation skills; information, media and technology skills; and life and career skills and how they can be incorporated into the teaching of core academic subjects.

A persuasive presentation that demonstrates to educators how to integrate the above concepts for a specific core academic subject area. The presentation includes: An overview of the 21st Century Learning framework concepts. Descriptions/definitions of: 21st century themes, learning & innovation skills, information, media and technology skills, & life/career skills. Specific examples of 3 or more learning activities that demonstrate application of these concepts for one academic subject.

9d368c66-e838-4029-a0f4-fb78b194074f.description: This verifiable credential endorses your thirst for improvement and participation in YP Week. This YP week digital badge validates your skills learned during YP Week and displays not only your interest in the YP Week themes and learning environments, but verifiable reflection and action to be a change-maker. You are a maker and leader interested in building up your community, self, and one another.
9d368c66-e838-4029-a0f4-fb78b194074f.name: YP Week Badge

badge_template_activities.title: The earner of this badge attended NEWaukee’s Young Professionals Week 2020, a national conference to challenge thinking, create space for community efforts making a positive change, and get involved with the leaders of tomorrow. The earner submitted a reflection detailing the action steps they will take to implement habits to build resilience, equity, and belonging. They also detailed how they will continue to positively impact their home community.

95d33735-cd16-4fed-af76-af599a6789a3.description: Crafts and defends plans for integrating technology throughout the school curriculum for the benefit of teaching and learning  [0.5]
95d33735-cd16-4fed-af76-af599a6789a3.name: Educational Technology and the Curriculum

badge_template_activities.title: A proposal for a technology integration plan that includes: an identification and brief description of a specific learning organization; a table, chart, or infographic that identifies the purpose and estimated frequency of specific technologies currently used by educators and learners within this organization;

The proposal also includes: A proposed target -- written as a big-picture goal statement or potential policy -- related to the use of technology within the learning organization (should address: how, why, and how often the technologies should be integrated in the curriculum); & transparent alignment between the technology integration proposal and the SAMR model, identifying at least two goals or targets that address Transformation--labeled as Modification or Redefinition.

The proposal also includes:  A statement or brief outline, identifying how the proposed plan helps educators to meet the ISTE NETS-T standards; & a description of how the proposed plan would add benefits to both teaching and learning within the learning organization.

f4a8489e-1458-4de1-b390-300663f34eae.description: Applies a variety of learning theories in the selection of online learning activities to help k-12 learners meet educational goals and outcomes [0.25]
f4a8489e-1458-4de1-b390-300663f34eae.name: pk-12 Learning Theories for Online Learning

badge_template_activities.title: Created or modified 3 learning activities for the online environment, each of which:  (1) applied a learning theory appropriate for the age and developmental level of the target learners, (2) included a rationale for choice of learning theory, and (3) included instruction directions and materials consistent with the chosen theory and age group.

Developed instructional materials to help those who teach or develop online educational materials for a specific k-12 audience to understand and apply a learning theory. The materials:  (1) were designed to help educators align the needs of a specific, k-12 audience and online learning experiences, (2) described at least one, specific learning theory for pK-12 learners, (3) shared one or more examples of how the theory could be applied in practice, and (4) included a brief "take-away" item.

Reflected on one of the learning activities submitted as evidence for this competency and addressed how the chosen learning theory: (1) informed the learning activity design, (2) provided a high-quality and high-impact learning experience for a pK-12 audience, (3) supported a learning advantage to developing this activity in the online learning environment, and (4) changed or enlightened the badge holder's understanding of the value of this learning theory.

3690c6a8-0b28-43f8-b63a-a53738f296ed.description: Analyzes existing non-educational and educational games for their potential application in education settings, and to garner insights for the design of future educational games. Makes game design decisions that are informed by a deepening understanding and celebration of timeless truths, virtues, and ethical principles.
3690c6a8-0b28-43f8-b63a-a53738f296ed.name: Educational Game Exploration and Analysis

badge_template_activities.title: A Learning Journal documenting what you are learning and experiencing as you try, test, and play 10 new games during this course. This is one of the best ways to deepen your knowledge about game design.  The journal should include:  10 games, at least 5 of which should be educational games, that the learner is playing for the first time. Evidence of a deepening knowledge of game features and approaches, their benefits and limitations.

A written review, video recording, or podcast that reviews at least 5 existing educational games. The review must:  Contain answers to an established list of 8-10 questions.  Questions from the list are approved by the instructor  You are welcome (even encouraged) to team up with a classmate on this part of the badge, but keep in mind you'll need to review 5 educational games per team member.

ad1c0ab0-5256-4a10-bdd6-5acee0504239.description: Designs educational game prototypes that engage a target audience of learners and create a measurable improvement in a stated area of learning.
ad1c0ab0-5256-4a10-bdd6-5acee0504239.name: Educational Game Prototyping

badge_template_activities.title: Design two educational game prototypes. For each, review research on an educational problem and analyze games that address it. Design and prototype a game. Test it with two groups, revising after each. The design of each game is informed by answers to the questions: What will people learn as a result of playing? Who is the target audience? What are three game alternatives that could achieve the educational goal? How can you ensure the elements of good games are included? How will you test it?

66f13e8f-4761-41bb-8987-2422dc2fcd6e.description: Reviews and draws from existing research on game design (and specifically educational game design) to inform promising educational practices
66f13e8f-4761-41bb-8987-2422dc2fcd6e.name: Game Design Psychology and Research

badge_template_activities.title: Create a source bibliography of at least 10 articles on games and learning.  For each article, provide a brief summary of the key ideas, followed by  a written reflection about how one or more ideas can inform or be applied to your school or classroom.

Record a thoughtful reflection on your learning experience, articulating how your research informs your decisions for game prototypes.  Include any thoughts on relevant research shared by classmates’ bibliographies.

Develop a presentation that helps other educators learn and apply principles of game design.  The presentation must be titled "10 Things Every Educator Should Know About Game Design", refer to at least three of the articles from the bibliography, include a brief outline, be comprised of 7-10 slides, and include citations.

a4739186-0957-4816-be71-7529762a97f1.description: Demonstrates foundational knowledge of the benefits and limitations of a variety of game design mechanics and types of games for application in education environments.
a4739186-0957-4816-be71-7529762a97f1.name: Game Mechanics and Game Type Analysis

badge_template_activities.title: Creates a game mechanics lexicon and recommendations - the options, when to use them, what considerations to keep in mind, and useful examples to consider.  Lexicon contains at least 20 terms.  Each term has options, considerations and examples.

Lexicon of Game Types and recommendations for usage - again, this resource should include options, what each are good at, their limitations, what the important considerations are with each one, and useful examples to consider.  Lexicon contains at least 20 items.  Each item has options, considerations and examples.

274ac81f-1bc5-44a0-b4e2-659f085c899c.description: Determines the major instructional goals for the course and learning objectives for each unit, and develops an assessment strategy that measures and gives timely feedback on student progress.
274ac81f-1bc5-44a0-b4e2-659f085c899c.name: Assessment and Feedback Strategies

badge_template_activities.title: Creates a document (in outline format) that contains a list of the major instructional goals for the course and the learning objectives for each unit.  Each learning objective should have at least one assessment mapped to it.  Provides a brief description of each assignment or assessment. Articulates somewhere in the document a strategy for  how feedback will be given (how quickly, using a rubric, etc.). How it will it benefit student progress (formative, summative, is re-submission allowed?).

823e41d0-f7a8-4f3a-bfe8-a67e37aa9bea.description: Develops an interaction strategy that fosters communication and collaboration among the members of the course’s learning community.
823e41d0-f7a8-4f3a-bfe8-a67e37aa9bea.name: Course Discussions and Interaction

badge_template_activities.title: Creates a plan document describing how course discussions (or similar) will be used in the course.  Plan documents include:  Identifies four methods for synchronous or asynchronous interaction among course members. Includes parameters for the instructor involvement. Describes how the discussions will aid learning.  Includes two standard course discussions, with at least one of them having the discussion starter prompt built around the integration of the Christian faith and the course content.
At least one of the standard discussions referenced in the document above has been completely built out in the LMS (please provide link or screen shot)

3e6a2703-5d6c-4430-aea9-1c72fe2bfca3.description: Creates a course shell in an LMS that includes a syllabus, organizational structure, and course schedule.
3e6a2703-5d6c-4430-aea9-1c72fe2bfca3.name: Course Structure and Organization

badge_template_activities.title: Builds an organizational structure inside the chosen LMS that uses folders, pages, etc. and provides a brief description of and rationale for the chosen structure  The structure should organize all the lessons, topics or other content for the course.  The structure should account for storing, managing, and giving students access to course documents.  The structure makes topics, time frames and deadlines clear to the student.  Where deadlines have not been determined, hypothetical ones are used.

Provides a rough draft of the syllabus and topical outline for the course, using an institutional template or creating a new one.  A significant portion of the information for the syllabus may not be available until the course is further along in the process, so this step is intended to get the very basics down. If a syllabus already exists for the course and will not be changed, using it without modifications is acceptable.

9adc66b2-7c50-4766-afb4-79f95657d15f.description: Tests course elements, including a course grade book, and develops a plan for continuous improvement.
9adc66b2-7c50-4766-afb4-79f95657d15f.name: Course Testing and Improvement

badge_template_activities.title: Builds an online grade book that accurately calculates student grades on individual assignments as well as an overall grade for the course based on the grading system set forth in the syllabus.  Inputs mock student data to test and confirm the course grade book is calculating correctly.  Submits a screen shot of accurate calculations in the grade book.
Creates a short reflection on the experience of submitting tests, assignments, etc. as a test user in the course. Did things work as planned? Were any errors found and fixed?

Creates a plan for continuous course improvement that includes a way to solicit and use student feedback (if your learning institution already has a course evaluation or student survey system in place, you can describe it here instead of creating your own).

1ea2f993-94bf-4c65-8fb1-3141f128ca8d.description: Communicates the relevance of the 10 Commandments for life and learning in the digital world. [0.5]
1ea2f993-94bf-4c65-8fb1-3141f128ca8d.name: 10 Commandments in the Digital World

badge_template_activities.title: A Bible study or interactive lesson intended to help a stated target audience (age 5-10, teenagers, grandparents, etc.) explore the relevance of the 10 Commandments in the digital world that includes: learning goals and/or objectives, one or more methods of measuring what students have or have not learned from the study/lesson, specific examples or cases about life in the digital world, and guidelines or guidance on living out the 10 Commandments in the digital age.

The Bible study or interactive lesson also helps learners to consider: the relevance of each commandment in the digital age and the nature of each of the 10 Commandments in digital contexts. Finally, it invites learners to apply the 10 Commandments to life in the digital world.

4e156015-dba6-402c-9a07-e99b36163285.description: Creates and/or curates the instructional content, resources, and tools necessary to help students meet instructional goals and objectives and builds these items into the Learning Management System.
4e156015-dba6-402c-9a07-e99b36163285.name: Course Building

badge_template_activities.title: Submit a link to the course (or screenshots) and note for the instructor which units you would like him or her to review.  This badge is about the instructor working with you to give help, advice, feedback, or anything else that will help you make progress building your online course.  The badge is earned when you have four units that have been completely built in the LMS, that have clear descriptions and directions throughout each unit, and that fit with the overall structure of your course.

ca1b12a2-dc0b-4d70-8721-55496000427a.description: Expertise and knowledge acquired and demonstrated in healthcare navigation and advocacy, enabling the learner to assist patients navigate various aspects of the patient experience, whether insurance or direct pay care is used. Offered in partnership with Advocates for Health Care and Pratter.us
ca1b12a2-dc0b-4d70-8721-55496000427a.name: Healthcare Advocate

badge_template_activities.title: Learner was exposed to content regarding medical billing and insurance, medical terminology, access to resources, and other healthcare navigation and advocacy concepts, then assessed in terms of their knowledge of these concepts. Learners will be equipped to take the examination to become a Board Certified Patient Advocate.

Learner was assessed in self-paced lectures followed by exams, until they reach a required level of fluency in terms of their knowledge of the key concepts. Areas of competency will include: (a) Medical and insurance terminology, (b) Medical billing and coding, (c) Consumer protection laws, (d) Pricing and hospital billing corrections.

f8ca6a72-db66-43ad-a088-132f6b03efaf.description: Employs a learning system, including a design strategy, Learning Management System, and technical support strategy that meets the needs of students, instructors, and other stakeholders.
f8ca6a72-db66-43ad-a088-132f6b03efaf.name: Systems and Strategies for Online Learning

badge_template_activities.title: Develops a Learning System Design document that includes:  The LMS chosen to house the course (1 page);  Strengths and affordances of the LMS; Weaknesses and limitations of the LMS;

A description of the design model chosen to develop the course (1 page):  Includes description of the model and why it was chosen (1 paragraph)  Compares and contrasts the chosen model with one other model (1-2 paragraphs)

A written technical support strategy that includes a description of (1 page):  Where students (and other faculty) can go for help and how they will know; Resources (hardware, applications, staff, etc.) needed to be gathered for the support system to work.

aae1c087-d177-4da7-b58b-a273553a1926.description: Defends the importance of understanding digital culture for evangelism, discipleship, and overall educational ministry in the 21st century. [0.25]
aae1c087-d177-4da7-b58b-a273553a1926.name: Digital Culture and Christian World View

badge_template_activities.title: A report on 5-7 articles (from peer-reviewed journals or other scholarly sources) that discuss how digital culture is influencing the beliefs and/or values of individuals (in the church, in schools, or in societies in general). The focus is on one or a couple of beliefs/values/topics that are of personal interest. This report is a 150-300 word summary of each article(s) followed by a 150-300 word analysis of the article(s).

eb76e5ef-1b7b-40f1-809d-aa7e8438c531.description: Defends the importance of understanding the spiritual implications of digital culture. [0.5]
eb76e5ef-1b7b-40f1-809d-aa7e8438c531.name: Digital Culture and Educational Ministry Foundations

badge_template_activities.title: An essay (400-600 words), narrated PowerPoint (approximately 5 minutes) or recorded video presentation (approximately 5 minutes) that addresses two or more examples of how digital culture is impacting the beliefs and values of people today (in the church, in school, or in society in general). Each example includes implications for these changes upon the mission of the Christian: opportunities, challenges, blessings, and dangers.

In addition, each example is supported and/or illustrated with at least three references to specific current events, research, and/or other sources.  All sources are cited properly and appropriate biblical references are included to support key ideas.

f0162a8d-baef-4046-b96f-80071b235cba.description: Facilitates student learning by 1) implementing a variety of teaching strategies based on theory & evidence, 2) using information technologies & communication skills, 3) fostering an environment that encourages learning and growth, and 4) personally modeling reflection, critical thinking, & lifelong learning.
f0162a8d-baef-4046-b96f-80071b235cba.name: Facilitate Learning

badge_template_activities.title: Passes the Competency 1 - Facilitate Learning Exam with 80% or better.
Completes a teaching style inventory (TPI) that models reflective thinking practices, including critical thinking

Displays professional letter(s) of recommendation that demonstrate the following:  1) Excellent interpersonal communication skills, 2) Enthusiasm for teaching, learning, and nursing that inspires and motivates students, and 3) Excellence as a role model in clinical practice settings.

Prepares the following components of their professional Curriculum Vitae (CV) that demonstrate the following:  1) Excellent interpersonal communication skills, 2) Excellence in physical and psychosocial assessment, and 3) Excellence in patient care  Specialty certifications (if any)
Identifies the TIGER competencies happening current (or most recent) place of employment, and chooses one more competency that may be added and explains how it would be planned.
Reflects on personal Teaching Perspective Inventory (TPI) by describing highest scores and determining if they accurately describe present teaching philosophy
Reports on a collegial working relationship with clinical agency personnel that could (or do) promote positive environments for learners
Reports on a journal article that highlights an evidence-based teaching practice that matches your personal teaching philosophy and explains how it matches

e5861483-bdea-474e-9dad-75e650a602d6.description: Selects web-based tools and appropriate research methods in the study of one or more aspects of digital culture. [0.25]
e5861483-bdea-474e-9dad-75e650a602d6.name: Internet Research Basics

badge_template_activities.title: A collection of 5-7 peer-reviewed /scholarly articles about digital culture. All articles focus on a theme of personal interest. For each article there is a one paragraph summary of the article and one paragraph describing / reflecting on notable insights for evangelism and/or discipleship.

9af4d97f-5a5a-4367-a73f-8fb392d1fe45.description: Identifies the individual learning styles and unique learning needs of diverse learners while 1) providing needed resources, 2) advising toward professional goals & role socialization, 3) fostering development in cognitive, affective & psychomotor domains, and 4) facilitating self-reflection.
9af4d97f-5a5a-4367-a73f-8fb392d1fe45.name: Learner Development and Socialization

badge_template_activities.title: Passes the Competency #2 -Facilitates Learner Development and Socialization Exam with a score of 80% or better.

Creates four lesson plans with learner's choice of topic(s) using the blank Active Teaching Map.  Uses a separate map for each lesson plan.  Uses this activity to develop relevant topics for personal career that could be used in practice.
Provides a paragraph for learner's CV that describes their personal, professional development, and how learner will encourage others to enhance their professional development
Reports and reflects on the learner's own VARK and KOLB learning style inventories, and their Meyers-Briggs personality inventory

f82f4113-b47f-41e0-b388-877fb29bb456.description: Uses assessment & evaluation strategies to develop nursing program standards and policies; finds, creates, and uses assessment instruments to evaluate learning outcomes; uses assessment & evaluation data and provides feedback to enhance the teaching-learning process
f82f4113-b47f-41e0-b388-877fb29bb456.name: Assessment and Evaluation Strategies

badge_template_activities.title: Passes the Competency #3 - Use Assessment & Evlauation Strategies Exam with an 80% or better.
Using a current syllabus, learner creates one set of evaluation criteria using a points system and one set of evaluation criteria using a percentage system.

Using a unit that the learner teaches now or in the past, and the Test Map template, the learner creates a test map by filling in the tables.  In addition, learner creates at least 3 test items of choice.
Creates a grading rubric for a written assignment of learner's choice.  Includes descriptors & performance levels and identifies rubric as analytic or holistic.
Provides a paragraph describing psychomotor assessment and provides one example.

Writes about an example that the learner or a colleague has experienced when providing constructive feedback to a student. Includes all six steps from this module, even if they did not actually happen during the situation.

Provides an example of how learner would know when to revise their teaching or assessment process from each of the following:  Test item analysis, written assignments, and clinical practicum evaluation tools.

14987b1f-48a7-453f-8c63-07ef3b0c68e9.description: Demonstrates knowledge of curriculum development including: outcomes, objectives, competencies, appropriate learning activities and evaluation.  Actively participates in the design of the curriculum to reflect: theory and research from the fields of nursing and education, the institutions philosophy, and community needs. Leads the development of curriculum and course design. Designs, implements and evaluates the program assessment plan. Analyzes, revises, and implements curriculum changes.
14987b1f-48a7-453f-8c63-07ef3b0c68e9.name: Curriculum Design & Evaluation

badge_template_activities.title: Passes the Competency #4 - Curriculum Design & Evaluation Exam with an 80% or better.

Using a previously created lesson: 1) adds a Course Objective that links to a Lesson Plan Objective. 2) adds a Leveled Learning Objective that links to the Course Objective. 3) adds a Program Outcome that links to the Leveled objective. 4) optionally revises any other components of the lesson plan as needed.

Creates a statement, usable in learner's personal teaching philosophy, that addresses:  1) personal mission statement; 2) thoughts on current nursing and health care trends, community and societal needs; 3) thoughts on nursing principles, standards, theory, and research; 4) thoughts on educational principles, theory, and research; and 5) personal feelings on use of technology in education.
Outlines a plan to develop a new course of learner's choice, or to revise an existing course.  Uses one or more of the Essentials or Competencies provided, or others.
Outlines an assessment plan for one course that learner teaches, or would like to teach.  Includes timelines.

Creates a plan, using the change model of learner's choice, to influence the faculty team, community/clinical partners, and learner's administration.  Uses the following case study:  you would love to see your nursing program integrate a community health practicum experience into every clinical course that now exists in the curriculum.  You are one faculty member with this dream.

dba6c736-0dc8-40c3-90bc-e76b981d1e39.description: Analyzes diverse representations of spirituality in digital contexts. [0.25]
dba6c736-0dc8-40c3-90bc-e76b981d1e39.name: Cyberspirituality

badge_template_activities.title: A series of 2-4 diary/journal entries (600-900 words), narrated PowerPoint (approximately 5-10 minutes), or recorded video diary (approximately 5-10 minutes) that:  documents 5-7 hours of exploring a specific area/theme/topic that relates to Christianity, spirituality, or online religion over a 1-2 week period, is in a journal format instead of a formal essay, and includes at least five difference digital "spaces" or five different experiences in one digital space.

11863e97-2f31-413c-877b-2460a0cf9435.description: Identifies and demonstrates strategies for educational, parish, and/or para-church ministry in the digital world based upon research of digital culture. [1.0]
11863e97-2f31-413c-877b-2460a0cf9435.name: Designing Plans for Digital Age Ministry

badge_template_activities.title: A proposal (Design Plans for Digital Age Ministry) for an educational ministry (fictional or something that will be implemented) at a church, school, or other setting. This project has a strong connection to digital culture. It can be an outreach ministry, a ministry focused more on people who are already Christians, or a combination of the two. As part of the proposal, there is a 1-3 minute video introduction and/or promotional piece for the proposed ministry.

An analysis of seven different and diverse digital ministries that includes for each: a thorough description of the ministry; audience identification; the mission, vision or goals of the ministry (may be assumed); assessment of the effectiveness in achieving the mission, vision or goals; identification of at least three aspects of the ministry that are unique to the digital medium and lead to achieving the ministry’s goals; identification of at least two things that could be improved.

A Digital Age Ministry plan that includes: a description (with target audience), a mission statement & 3+ strategic goals, ministry components/traits that satisfy each goal, a list of needed resources, a description and justification of the technical platform, a list of risks or weaknesses, a development & implementation plan, a privacy plan, a promotion plan, a sustainability plan including day to day operation & long-term leadership, & the criteria to determine if the ministry is successful.

c3b6c3e5-ba71-48c6-ae6e-bdab34ed162a.description: (1) Exhibits a spirit of inquiry about teaching and learning, student development, and evaluation methods, (2) Uses evidence-based resources to improve and support teaching, (3) Participates in research activities related to nursing education, (4) Shares teaching expertise with colleagues and others, and (5) Demonstrates integrity as a scholar
c3b6c3e5-ba71-48c6-ae6e-bdab34ed162a.name: Engage in the Scholarship of Teaching

badge_template_activities.title: Passes the Competency #7 - Engage in the Scholarship of Teaching Exam with an 80% or better.

Searches for and submits two professional nursing journal author guidelines, and provides an example of something that could be written to fit one of the categories of each journal. At least one of the journals must be from the nursing education profession.

Demonstrates the use of evidence-based resources to improve and support teaching by providing an informal lesson plan example with references.  If a specific example cannot be provided, the learner provides a paragraph describing an example of how one could start using EVTP.

Demonstrates participation in research activities related to nursing education by describing their research activity in a paragraph and also rating herself/himself using the Rubric for Evaluation of Scholarship of Teaching from Ward (2008). If specific examples cannot be provided, the learner provides a written problem statement about nursing education and a research question for the identified problem.

Lists examples of ways the learner has shared teaching expertise with colleagues and others, and adds them to their CV if so desired.  If specific examples cannot be provided, the learner provides a paragraph describing an example of how she/he could begin sharing their expertise.

4627ae08-612f-4c75-b6af-a2bcc11ede08.description: Employees earn the Engagement & Team Performance digital badge through active participation in 10 hours of instructional time and 5-10 hours of personal reflection and application time. The four modules include: Strengths Based Management, Foundations of Employee Engagement, Planning for Employee Engagement, and Managing Engagement Performance
4627ae08-612f-4c75-b6af-a2bcc11ede08.name: Engagement & Team Performance

badge_template_activities.title: Completed active participation in 10 hours of instructional time and 5-10 hours of personal reflection and application time.

8dd46174-81b1-415b-9e50-81cc46605a62.description: Function as a Change Agent and Leader at one’s institution, in the local community, and regionally by:  (1) modeling cultural sensitivity, (2) evaluating organizational effectiveness, (3) Enhancing the visibility of nursing, (4) participating in efforts to address health care and educational needs, (5)  implementing strategies for, adapting to, and creating a culture for change, (6) developing leadership skills in others, (9) advocating for nursing and nursing education in the political arena
8dd46174-81b1-415b-9e50-81cc46605a62.name: Function as a Change Agent and Leader

badge_template_activities.title: Passes the Competency #5 - Function as a Change Agent and Leader Exam with an 80% or better.
Learner reported their Keirsey Temperament Report leadership personality profile.

Learner documents an example from their career of any of the following: (1) Enhances the visibility of nursing by providing leadership in the nursing program, parent institution, local community, or region  (2) Advocates for nursing or nursing education in the political arena  (3) Participates in efforts to address health care and educational needs (4) Models cultural sensitivity when advocating for change  (5) Creates a culture for change within a nursing program or institution.
Reflect on your Keirsey Temperament Report leadership personality profile.  Do you agree or disagree with the results?  Why?

If you have not submitted a portfolio entry on the criteria listed in Activity 2, note why at the beginning of this entry. Next, provide an example of HOW you could meet at least portions of those criteria. Considered using a change model in this plan.

e58aece4-578a-4b54-a629-56ebe844ad61.description: (1) Identifies how social, economic, political, and institutional forces influence nursing education, (2) Makes decisions based on knowledge of historical and current issues in higher education, (3) Integrates the values of respect, collegiality, professionalism, and caring to build a climate that fosters the development of learners and colleagues, (4) Considers the goals of the nursing program and the parent institution when managing issues, and (5) Participates on institutional committees
e58aece4-578a-4b54-a629-56ebe844ad61.name: Function Effectively in the Organizational and Academic Community

badge_template_activities.title: Passes the Competency #8 - Function Effectively in the Organizational and Academic Community Exam with a score of 80% or better.

Submits a Curriculum Vitae (CV) that includes the following:  (1) Full name, credentials, and contact information, (2) Educational history, (3) Academic/Teaching Experience, (4) Graduate committee mentoring, (5) Publications, (6) Peer-reviewed presentations, (7) Grants, (8) Service to the University, the Nursing school, the Profession, and the Community, (9) Certifications & Licenses, (10) Recent pertinent academic continued education, and (11) Clinical Nursing Experience

Creates or updates a personal teaching philosophy.  Clearly describes their guiding philosophy of teaching and personal mission statement, using engaging language appropriate to nursing and education. Includes the following:  (1) Goals for student learning, (2) Preferred and/or strongest teaching methods, (3) Prefered assessment of student learning strategies, (4) Diversity, and (5) Specific measurable goals for their teaching practice for year one, three, and five.

Documents reflection on how portions of the learner's teaching philosophy aligns with current or future employers.  If the learner plans to sit for the CNE exam, he/she includes reflection on things the planned before sitting for the exam

db298ba2-619d-4db5-aee3-8fa1f9d94251.description: Applies multiple models for evangelism and discipleship ministry in digital contexts to meet specific ministry needs. [0.25]
db298ba2-619d-4db5-aee3-8fa1f9d94251.name: Models for Ministry in Digital Contexts

badge_template_activities.title: An essay (500-800 words), narrated PowerPoint (5-10 min), or recorded video presentation (5-10 min) that is written/spoken as if presented to a church or school staff as part of a small professional development activity. It includes a description for each category of 1-2 benefits and 1-2 limitations of: using digital world illustrations in ministry settings, the "preparing for battle" approach to educational ministry in the digital world, and the "ministry in the digital world" approach.

The project also includes a list of 3-5 specific ideas on how one's church or school could use these ideas to address new ministry opportunities or to address existing ministry challenges. All sources are cited properly, and appropriate biblical references are included to support key ideas.

dbf17591-de84-47d0-aaf7-50521c83f22b.description: Engages in activities that promote role socialization. Participates in professional organizations. Demonstrates a commitment to lifelong learning and participates in professional development.  Manages the teaching, scholarship, and service demands of the role. Uses feedback from self and others to improve effectiveness. Adheres to legal and ethical standards for nursing education. Mentors and supports colleagues in nurse educator roles. Engages in self-reflection to improve teaching practices.
dbf17591-de84-47d0-aaf7-50521c83f22b.name: Systematic Self-Evaluation and Improvement

badge_template_activities.title: Passes the Competency #6 - Facilitate Learner Development and Socialization Exam with an 80% or better.

Document at least one way you demonstrate EACH of the following:  (1) Engages in activities that promote socialization into the role, (2) Maintains membership in professional organizations, (3) Participates actively in professional organizations through committee work and/or leadership roles, (4) Participates in professional development opportunities (professional conference attendance, continued education credits, certifications), (5) Mentors and supports colleagues in the nurse educator role.
Using the model presented by Savory (2012), write three separate memos for a peer.  1) Course Goals, 2) Analyze Teaching Methods, 3) Document Student Learning or Performance.
Create a five-year plan to demonstrate commitment to life-long learning
For any of the items from Activity 1 that were not added to your portfolio, provide one document demonstrating how you will meet the competencies in your future.
If a terminal degree is not held by the learner, a reflective statement is created about their future potential to obtain one, and which type is preferred.

5424b625-4c3e-42aa-a224-9bfd0b319b1c.description: Articulates and applies the power of brand as a critical factor of organizational success. Describes and employs the mind-sets and behaviors of strategic brand development, management, and marketing. Applies research-based, problem-solving strategies in professional practice. Identifies and analyzes a brand problem in a way that addresses fundamental causes and suggests clear, strategic solutions. Reflects on the application of strategic brand management to their role as leader.
5424b625-4c3e-42aa-a224-9bfd0b319b1c.name: Strategic Branding Management

badge_template_activities.title: Active participation in an 8-week course of study including five, three-hour live class sessions.
7-10 hours per week in doctoral level academic reading, case study analysis and writing, and discussion forum responses.

Production of the Brand Problem Paper, a 7-10 page research project that recommends brand solutions, anchored in relevant academic literature, to solve strategic management and organizational problems within the learner’s current leadership context.

Production of the Brand Audit Project, a comprehensive exploration and analysis of an existing brand that results in a 15 minute presentation, with supporting media, that analyzes the critical elements of brand identity and their effective use.

7a0fa851-28e6-4b25-b62b-cfbad790a1e6.description: Demonstrates advanced educational design and technology knowledge expertise to solve a real-world problem or meet a real-world need.
7a0fa851-28e6-4b25-b62b-cfbad790a1e6.name: Advanced Problem Solving in Educational Design and Technology

badge_template_activities.title: Creates a document that:  (1) clearly identifies a problem in an educational context; (2) states the specific context and documents any important background information; (3) includes evidence of reflection that attempts to understand the problem from the perspective of those impacted; (4) systematically researches and documents potential solutions; (5) Devises and/or selects a solution; (6) implements the selected solution; (7) creates a plan for evaluation and determining efficacy.

0c2e600b-4c46-4e80-8661-4daea3ca6419.description: Demonstrates advanced educational design and technology knowledge by prototyping and testing a new product, program or service.
0c2e600b-4c46-4e80-8661-4daea3ca6419.name: Advanced Prototyping in Educational Design and Technology

badge_template_activities.title: Works with one or more team members to create educational products, services, or program prototypes and devises effective processes for evaluating the effectiveness of the prototypes.  Provides copies of at least two prototypes and related materials.  Includes a detailed description of the steps involved in creating and testing the prototypes.
Documents an 800-1000 word reflection and analysis of the process used in creating the prototype(s).

6ccccbd4-4ec2-49ea-bddc-20b1942930bb.description: Collaborates with stake holders to create a clear, cohesive, comprehensive grant proposal.
6ccccbd4-4ec2-49ea-bddc-20b1942930bb.name: Building Strategic Partnerships

badge_template_activities.title: Crafts a presentation or newsletter to share data collected through a survey of stakeholders, a focus group, or an analysis of current needs or gaps in the curriculum.  Provides documentation for the identified need(s); Includes statistics where appropriate; Justifies the appropriateness of proposed solution with research on best practices.

Creates a letter of inquiry or concept paper that includes the following:  a brief description of your organization A description of the issue or need; brief outline of the program or project activities and specific goals; indication of how the project connects to the grant maker’s areas of interest; indication of who will be responsible for managing the project, including potential collaborators; an estimate of project cost and the amount you intend to request in your proposal.

0bc1ed83-387c-467f-89b4-b2a87e2b14aa.description: Badge Holders have evaluated the benefits of building a robust assessment plan that extends beyond a standard letter grade system. They have analyzed the benefits and limitations of formative and summative assessment, compared and contrasted the benefits of a variety of approaches to assessment (including self-assessment, peer-assessment, narrative assessment, competency-based education, and portfolio assessment), and designed a rich and authentic feedback system.
0bc1ed83-387c-467f-89b4-b2a87e2b14aa.name: Classroom Assessment Makeover

badge_template_activities.title: Evaluated the benefits of building a robust assessment plan that extends beyond a standard letter grade system, analyzing the benefits and limitations of formative and summative assessments, compared and contrasted the benefits of a variety of approaches to assessment (including self-assessment, peer-assessment, narrative assessment, competency-based education, and portfolio assessment), and designed a rich and authentic feedback system.

52e8e313-970d-4213-89af-c3270f476e8f.description: The culmination of 3 subsequent micro credentials in Coding Fundamentals. The learner now has the ability to write intermediate level computer programs that leverage basic programming skills while leveraging custom functions, collection types, and data processing.
52e8e313-970d-4213-89af-c3270f476e8f.name: Coding Fundamentals

badge_template_activities.title: Learner was exposed to a programming education methodology that has evolved over the past 20 years to best jump start a skillset in computer programming. Multiple small projects were created to drill those programming skills.

Learner was assessed in self-paced lectures followed by exams, until they reach a required level of fluency in terms of their knowledge of the key concepts. Areas of competency will include: (a) arrays (b) lists (c) dictionaries (d) arrays (e) lists (f) dictionaries (g) XML (h) JSON (i) Data Parsing
Coding Fundamentals: Python Coding Fundamentals
Coding Fundamentals: Working with Collections
Coding Fundamentals: Working with Data

27a8b49f-280a-4dfb-8513-d522cbf83f56.description: Basic computer programming competency has been achieved in the context of Python programming. The learner now has the foundational skills needed to explore other programming languages at the basic level.
27a8b49f-280a-4dfb-8513-d522cbf83f56.name: Coding Fundamentals: Python Coding Fundamentals

badge_template_activities.title: Learner was exposed to a programming education methodology that has evolved over the past 20 years to best jump start a skillset in computer programming. Multiple small projects were created to drill those programming skills over a period of 15 hours of instruction.

Learner was assessed through five hours of video lectures, two papers on the history application of programming, followed by one applied computer programming project-based assignment, until they reach a required level of fluency in terms of their knowledge of the key concepts. For those transferring for undergraduate level transfer, trainees must obtain a passing rate of 80% or higher. Areas of competency will include: (a) variables (b) conditionals (c) loops (d) functions.

c73a5934-24c8-4f6f-ac40-a7deedc4cc54.description: Multiple collection types are introduced and the learner is able to determine which collection type is most appropriate for different scenarios.
c73a5934-24c8-4f6f-ac40-a7deedc4cc54.name: Coding Fundamentals: Working with Collections

badge_template_activities.title: Learner was exposed to a programming education methodology that has evolved over the past 20 years to best jump start a skillset in computer programming. Multiple small projects were created to drill those programming skills.

Learner was assessed in self-paced lectures followed by exams, until they reach a required level of fluency in terms of their knowledge of the key concepts. Areas of competency will include: (a) arrays (b) lists (c) dictionaries.

4795d41e-253e-45d6-a76b-758253f85914.description: All computer programs operate on the inputs they have available. The learner is exposed to different data types and formats and explores how that data can be processed and interpreted by the computer program for decision making.
4795d41e-253e-45d6-a76b-758253f85914.name: Coding Fundamentals: Working with Data

badge_template_activities.title: Learner was exposed to a programming education methodology that has evolved over the past 20 years to best jump start a skillset in computer programming. Multiple small projects were created to drill those programming skills.

Learner was assessed in self-paced lectures followed by exams, until they reach a required level of fluency in terms of their knowledge of the key concepts. Areas of competency will include: (a) XML (b) JSON (c) Data Parsing.

59df383c-8874-4fe0-84ca-b16fb5649809.description: Designs a comprehensive plan to fund innovative technology-supported practices, including a list of potential funders whose funding interests match the school’s technology supported goals identified in the mission, vision, and strategic plan.
59df383c-8874-4fe0-84ca-b16fb5649809.name: Financial Planning for Educational Design and Technology

badge_template_activities.title: Builds an annotated list of 15 or more potential funders that could help meet the identified needs of your organization. List includes: a variety of grant sizes and a few non-grant resources. Includes the following for each funder listed: name, contact information, website address, funding priorities, limitations, restrictions, activities the funder will not support, geographic focus, requirements, explanation of how the identified needs/initiatives fit this organization’s funding priorities.

de2b3f86-c8d9-47a7-86e5-93db68e4fb04.description: Writes a complete grant proposal following all of the directions explained in the request for proposals
de2b3f86-c8d9-47a7-86e5-93db68e4fb04.name: Grant Writing for Educational Technology

badge_template_activities.title: Writes a complete grant proposal.  Includes the complete directions from the RFP or Common Grant Application. Follows the directions precisely. Includes a compelling narrative that clearly identifies the objectives, justifies the need the program addresses, and explains the plan for implementation. Includes a comprehensive budget linking expense to outcome. Includes an evaluation plan that may consist of gathering data to measure student growth, and includes all supplemental documentation.

Creates a plan specifying follow-up steps subsequent to the acceptance or rejection of the proposal:  Includes a plan to publicize the funding and thank the funder. Includes a plan for implementation, management, and evaluation of the funds and program. Includes a plan to use feedback if the proposal is rejected and seek funding elsewhere.

c6858419-2a58-4295-ba9f-d5d6dc002729.description: Demonstrates advanced educational design and technology knowledge by supporting the mission, vision, values, and/or goals of an organization or learning institution.
c6858419-2a58-4295-ba9f-d5d6dc002729.name: Maintaining the Mission Focus in Educational Design and Technology

badge_template_activities.title: Creates a document that:  (1) demonstrates an understanding of the institution’s strategic plan and how one's work fits into the plan; (2) frames how one's work is specifically supporting aspects of a stated institutional mission; (3) using rich explanation, curates learning journal pieces from throughout the internship and relates them to the organizational goals.
